org.pepstock.charba.client.options

Class Scale

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.commons.NativeObjectContainer
      • org.pepstock.charba.client.options.AbstractModel<Options,IsDefaultScale>
        • org.pepstock.charba.client.options.Scale
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsDefaultScale
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtendedScale, GlobalScale

    public class Scale
extends AbstractModel<Options,IsDefaultScale>
implements IsDefaultScale
    Axes are an integral part of a chart. They are used to determine how data maps to a pixel value on the chart.
    In a cartesian chart, there is 1 or more X axis and 1 or more Y axis to map points onto the 2 dimensional canvas. These axes are know as 'cartesian axes'.
    Axes that follow a cartesian grid are known as 'Cartesian Axes'. Cartesian axes are used for line, bar, and bubble charts. Four cartesian axes are included by default.
    • linear
    • logarithmic
    • category
    • time

    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

      • setBarPercentage

        public final void setBarPercentage(double barPercentage)
        Sets the percent (0-1) of the available width each bar should be within the category width. 1.0 will take the whole category width and put the bars right next to each other.
        Parameters:
        barPercentage - percent (0-1) of the available width each bar should be within the category width. 1.0 will take the whole category width and put the bars right next to each other.

      • getBarPercentage

        Returns:

      • setBarThickness

        public final void setBarThickness(int barThickness)
        Sets the width of each bar in pixels. If not set, the base sample widths are calculated automatically so that they take the full available widths without overlap. Then, the bars are sized using barPercentage and categoryPercentage.
        Parameters:
        barThickness - width of each bar in pixels. If not set, the base sample widths are calculated automatically so that they take the full available widths without overlap. Then, the bars are sized using barPercentage and categoryPercentage.

      • getBarThickness

        public final int getBarThickness()
        Returns the width of each bar in pixels. If not set, the base sample widths are calculated automatically so that they take the full available widths without overlap. Then, the bars are sized using barPercentage and categoryPercentage.
        Specified by:
        getBarThickness in interface IsDefaultScale
        Returns:
        width of each bar in pixels. If not set, the base sample widths are calculated automatically so that they take the full available widths without overlap. Then, the bars are sized using barPercentage and categoryPercentage.
